text: Guillaume Stengel funeral on May 18, 1917 Wilhelm Ludwig "Guillaume" Stengel (August 7, 1846 - May 15, 1917) was a musician and a music teacher. ==Biography== He was born on August 7, 1846, in Lviv. Marcella Sembrich become one of his students and they married in 1877. He became ill from blood poisoning from a carbuncle that developed from a scratch on his lip. He had his first operation on May 6, 1917. His health improved temporarily. He died at his apartment in the Hotel Gotham in Manhattan on May 15, 1917, from the blood poisoning after his third operation. His funeral was at the Church of St. Mary the Virgin in Manhattan and the temporary burial until the end of the war was at Woodlawn Cemetery. he had 20 pallbearers including, Paul Drennan Cravath, Harry Harkness Flagler, Zygmunt Stojowski, Ernest Schelling and Ignacy Jan Paderewski. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1846 births Category:1917 deaths Category:Deaths from sepsis
title: Guillaume Stengel
